name: Thistle Brighton

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Thistle Brighton. What a great place to stay when in town. Excellent location opposite the sea front and close to pier and other attractions.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel gave an air of spaciousness and was very light and welcoming. The main foyer area is comfortable and offers a good menu. The dining room has lovely sea views to enjoy. Can't fault the food and it was reasonably priced for the quantity and quality, both for breakfast and for dinner. The room was spacious, clean, functional and again, had a lovely sea view which made it even more special.
reviews.title: Blown out at the Thistle

reviews.text: To cap it all off we found the staff in all departments very efficient and friendly. They were particularly attentive to my children and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel!

reviews.text: Thanks to all at the Thistle Brighton.
reviews.title: Tired, but good location

reviews.text: £200 for a one night stay - excluding car park and breakfast - this one of the worst top flight hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff had no interest in the report of no soap in the reception toilets other than to say it had been ordered weeks ago. Refusal by staff to provide snacks in the bar after 11pm was met with you'll have to order from room service. Bar staff did not know what a Pinot Grigio was nor could they provide a highball glass for a long drink Raise their game - they deserve to be sacked. The hotel manager offered a complementary nights stay which was declined. A request for alternative compensation by them making a donation to a local charity
reviews.title: loved the service and hospitality

reviews.text: Stayed here recently for 2 nights along with partners parents to attend a family wedding. Hotel is not much to look at externally (looks like a concrete office block) however, this is not the case internally and seeing as that is where you will be staying that's what counts. The Atrium is beautiful, light and airy. The staff were wonderfully polite, efficient and helpful. Location of the hotel was second to none. Air con in our room didn't work we reported it to reception and when we came back from dinner we had a portable unit in our room all switched on. Hotel provided a travel cot for our little girl and again that was in the room completely made up for us upon our return from dinner. Had a wonderful time and would recommend
reviews.title: Wonderful Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this Hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — Screaming children in the lounge, (Parents control your kids)

reviews.text: I have just returned from staying two nights in the Thistle Hotel Brighton. The room was a little dated but very comfortable. The hotel has a great location right for the sea front and the back of the lanes. This is a great hotel if you dont like to be bothered, you can come and go as you please without having to deal with staff. If your looking to be waited on check into a boutique hotel as thats what they specialise in (check my review for the Drakes hotel, Brighton). Overall, great value, great location, would stay again.
reviews.title: Absolutely appalling!!

reviews.text: Booked a family room for one night (spefically adding that we were 2 adults and 2 kids) and was quoted £200, including breakfast. Room was tiny, only to discover the next day that we had been put into a "seaview room". The lock on the door didn't work (it looked as if it had been broken for ages) and we were asked whether we wanted to move rooms! Eh, yes.
reviews.title: But don't be put of by this bland concrete and green glass monstrosity

likes.liked: — Sorted my air conditioning problem very fast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I queried why the hotel was advertising rooms for £99 that same night and was told that bookings worked like "airlines" (sic), i.e. the earlier you booked, the cheaper the room. I understood that but said that if I walked in now and booked a room I would get it for £99. No reply.
reviews.title: I cant see what all the “who harr” is about!

likes.liked: — Great comfy beds, nice smellies in the bathroom

reviews.title: Good hotel In My Opinion
reviews.text: Have just come back from a 2night stay here on a fri / satu night.
I was in room 160 an executive suite on the new side of the hotel. Paid a very very reasonable £80 per night BB
reviews.title: Warm Welcome On A Cold Day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a good size, nice and clean and very very comfy bed. We found all the staff to be very pleasant without being overly in your face.
reviews.title: Hotel Good. Expect mannerless chavs as fellow guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good breakfast and plenty of it in the morning. I particuarly liked the hotel as it was about 15 mins walk from the pier so you had
reviews.title: pleasant!

likes.disliked: — The window to the inside of the hotel and the coffee

reviews.text: a good reason to walk of those extra calories you have piled on over the weekend. Please note the parking is limited. We just parked the car on the road right opposite and paid £1 per hour between 9am - 6pm the rest is free. If you can get a spot in the hotel they charge £10 per night.
reviews.title: Dirty and Horrible Service

reviews.text: We booked this hotel at the last minute for a mid-week break and arrived shortly before 1pm.
reviews.title: Must Try Harder!
Disappointing
reviews.text: On asking whether it was possible to check in so that i could feed my 6 month old baby in private, we were curtly told that check in was from 2pm only. We proceeded to sit down in the lobby so that i could feed my daughter and retrieve a fresh set of clothes and nappies and miraculously not only did a room become available but we were also upgraded to a larger room with a sea view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the room (311) was a fantastic size and comfortably accomodated our travel cot AND stroller without having to climb over furnniture. Unfortunately the air conditioning was useless and the coolest temperature for our stay was 24 degrees. Luckily, i had remembered some light bedding for my daughters cot thanks to previous reviews about this so we made do rather than add a noisy and obtrusive portable unit to our room.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.liked: — The bed is was sooooooooooooo comfortable

reviews.text: However, the room was quiet and clean.
reviews.title: depressing!

reviews.text: We had a fantastic day out and returned to the hotel at about 10pm and decided to have cofffee and dessert before bed. Although the service was quick for my husbands cold drink, i had to wait over 20 minutes for my coffee and strawberry tart.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in seaside town

description: As relaxed and easy-going as the city itself, Thistle Brighton is situated directly on the seafront and just a short stroll from the Pier, with some of the South’s best shopping, theatre and entertainment also within walking distance.
